subject: Marketing
title: The Flesch-Kincaid Lesson
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Flesch-Kincaid Lesson.

hook.text: The most successful ads in history are written at a 6th-grade reading level. Simplicity sells.

buildup.text: The Flesch-Kincaid test measures readability based on sentence length and syllable count.

discovery.text: Lower readability scores mean more people understand the messageâ€”and more people act on it.

twist.text: Simple writing isn't a sign of simple thinking. It's the result of extremely clear thinking.

climax.text: Every complex word and long sentence is a barrier between the reader and the sale.

punchline.text: Write so a sixth grader gets it. Everyone else will too.

quiz.question: What reading level are the most successful ads written at?
